IVB_CFM_Astarion.synopsis: After giving Astarion the Tome of Thayan Necromancy, he begins to study it at camp to learn its secrets. He's frustrated by the voices of the spirits contained within the book, which are stopping him from accessing the secrets he's sure it contains. If he pushes the spirits too far, they'll respond with force - tearing at him with spectral hands. As you discuss the book with Astarion, his tone is on edge - nearly obsessive about discovering what's in the book. He won't part with it, even if he can't read it right now.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_22.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_22.text: Come on, come on. What are you hiding?
IVB_CFM_Astarion_22.context: NodeContext: Looking through the book, talking to self/book

IVB_CFM_Astarion_21.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_21.text: Can you summon the dead? Bring them back? Can you - ugh, can you shut up and let me read?
IVB_CFM_Astarion_21.context: NodeContext: 'ugh, can you shut up and let me read?' is said to the book. There are spirits that only Astarion can hear, trying to tempt him.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_76.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_76.text: I was just perusing this little find and - WILL YOU SHUT UP?!
IVB_CFM_Astarion_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion slams the open book shutNodeContext: Starts speaking to the player, but then shouts at the book, which he then slams shut. He's been hearing voices coming out of the book. The player can't hear them.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_48.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_48.text: Forgive me. This book reads you more than you read it.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_41.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_41.text: I mean it plays with your mind. There are secrets here, but the book has spirits. They fight you every step of the way.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_2.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_2.text: Sounds dangerous. Maybe you should leave it alone.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_19.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_19.text: No, there's something in here. But the voices - the spirits in the book won't let me see it.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_62.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_62.text: I almost reached the end before they drove me out. And drove me all but mad.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_12.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_12.text: I got deep into the pages of this book before they drove me out. And almost drove me mad.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_58.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_58.text: Now every time I open it, the voices surge back into my mind. I can't reason with them - they exist to protect that book.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_9.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_9.text: Gale would take it off your hands.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_35.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_35.text: No! He's not eating this one. It's too valuable.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_6.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_6.text: It's powerful magic, not to be toyed with. I could take it off your hands.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_51.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_51.text: No! You're not eating this one. It's too valuable.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_67.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_67.text: Generous, but I'd prefer to keep it. It may be rather valuable.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_56.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_56.text: I don't know. That's the point - they're secret.
IVB_CFM_Astarion_56.context: NodeContext: the player asked a stupid question: "what secrets?"

IVB_CFM_Astarion_70.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_70.text: Is there anything we can do?

IVB_CFM_Astarion_14.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_14.text: Maybe. Maybe not. It's hard to know what's lurking in here.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_71.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_71.text: Someone went through a lot of trouble to protect this tome. It has to be something more than a book of cantrips.
IVB_CFM_Astarion_71.context: NodeContext: Cantrips = very minor magical spells.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_42.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_42.text: Still, I doubt this will help us with our parasites. Maybe it's better to put it aside for now.
IVB_CFM_Astarion_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astariion puts the book away.NodeContext: Puts the book away.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_38.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_38.text: Yes, best to focus on what's urgent.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_24.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_24.text: Indeed. As long as the spirits remember their mission, the book is a lost cause.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_53.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_53.text: And I should rest. This has all been a lot.
IVB_CFM_Astarion_53.context: NodeContext: Weary after mentally battling the spirits in the book.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_11.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_11.text: Keep at it. Maybe you'll figure out a way.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_25.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_25.text: As long as those spirits remember their mission, I doubt it. Keeping the book safe is all they know.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_32.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_32.text: But still, we live in hope. Figuratively speaking.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_10.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_10.text: What are you hoping to find in there anyway?

IVB_CFM_Astarion_65.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_65.text: It's a book of necromancy, full of secrets about controlling the dead, returning the dead to life, and who knows what else.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_46.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_46.text: Whatever's in here, it might give me an edge over Cazador. Or free me from him entirely.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_5.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_5.text: Although I can't make any progress as long as those spirits remember their mission. It seems to be all they know.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_36.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_36.text: Still. If nothing else, maybe I can beat Cazador to death with it.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_60.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_60.text: Whatever's in here, it might give me an edge over my old master Cazador. Or free me from him entirely.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_47.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_47.text: I could hold on to it if you like?

IVB_CFM_Astarion_49.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_49.text: Trust me, the spirits won't be any kinder to you. As long as they remember their duty to protect this book, no one's getting in.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_26.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_26.text: Anyway, I'd rather keep it where I can see it. Its time will come, I'm sure.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_73.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_73.text: No! There's something in here - I know it.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_0.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_0.text: Then steel your mind and destroy them. Simple.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_7.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_7.text: I wouldn't be trying to reason with them if 'murder' was an option, would I?

IVB_CFM_Astarion_17.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_17.text: They're too strong for that. They must be hiding something good.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_40.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_40.text: It sounds like you need an exorcism.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_43.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_43.text: Perhaps. But would that damage the tome itself?

IVB_CFM_Astarion_18.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_18.text: Probably. It's a tome of necromancy, after all.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_23.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_23.text: I can't risk it. There's something valuable in here.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_34.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_34.text: Thank you, very helpful. But I can't risk it. There's something valuable in here.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_33.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_33.text: I only read one page before their maddening whispers drove me away.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_27.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_27.text: I barely opened it when they started whispering from the shadows.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_50.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_50.text: I can't. I feel a connection with it, but the spirits within fight me at every step.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_59.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_59.context: NodeContext: Realises the player is nearby and talking to him. A little rattled, you've been talking to a haunted book.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_4.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_4.text: No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe Wyll...
IVB_CFM_Astarion_4.context: NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

IVB_CFM_Astarion_15.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_15.text: No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe Shadowheart...
IVB_CFM_Astarion_15.context: NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

IVB_CFM_Astarion_64.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_64.text: No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe the gith...
IVB_CFM_Astarion_64.context: NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

IVB_CFM_Astarion_3.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_3.text: No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe Gale...
IVB_CFM_Astarion_3.context: NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

IVB_CFM_Astarion_69.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_69.text: I can't. I won't. Now - stop!
IVB_CFM_Astarion_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion struggles against invisible spectral hands.NodeContext: Spectral hands start to appear around you, grabbing at you. These hands are invisible to the player, but you can see them. You struggle against them.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_13.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion closes the book with great effortNodeContext: You strain against the hands and snap the book shut, at which point the invisible hands vanish and you're free. You notice the player looking at you.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_45.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_45.text: A unique read, certainly. A tome of necromancy, guarded by spirits.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_29.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_29.text: What in the hells was that?

IVB_CFM_Astarion_20.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_20.text: I'm not sure. A dance with death, maybe.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_37.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_37.text: This is a powerful book of necromancy, but it's guarded by spirits.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_74.speaker: Player
IVB_CFM_Astarion_74.text: You're not killing anyone in this party.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_61.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_61.text: Of course I'm not. It's just - it gets to you.
IVB_CFM_Astarion_61.context: NodeContext: referring to the book you're holding, and the voices you hear.

IVB_CFM_Astarion_39.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_39.text: No, I won't kill them! Well, maybe the tiefling...
IVB_CFM_Astarion_39.context: NodeContext: The book's telling you to kill your companions. An emphatic no, then considering

IVB_CFM_Astarion_57.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_57.text: No - stop it - I won't kill them!
IVB_CFM_Astarion_57.context: NodeContext: To book. stop it = 'stop saying that'

IVB_CFM_Astarion_8.speaker: Astarion
IVB_CFM_Astarion_8.text: Just tell me what I need to know. Tell me your secrets.
